title: National Party (Sweden)
text: The National Party of the Upper House (), commonly known as the National Party (), was a <a href="conservative">conservative</a> <a href="political%20party">political party</a> in the upper house of <a href="Parliament%20of%20Sweden">Swedish parliament</a>, formed in 1912 through the merging of the <a href="United%20Right%20Party">United Right Party</a> () and the <a href="Moderate%20Party%20of%20the%20Upper%20House">Moderate Party of the Upper House</a> (). In 1935 the party merged into the parliamentary group of the <a href="Moderate%20Party">General Electoral Union</a> (), together with the <a href="Lantmanna%20and%20Bourgeois%20Party">Lantmanna and Bourgeois Party</a> ().
